Body:
I'm a not a native speaker and I just begun studying English.

I'm not used to phonetics at all. I know that is has something to do with pronunciation, but I really don't have any idea.

I'll be grateful for any help.
Title: English: Why can’t you ever find [l] opposed to [ɫ]? And why can’t you ever find [h] opposed to [ŋ]?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Web developer since 1997. Other interests include embedded systems, static program analysis, and software visualization.

Oh, and you can vote for my LEGO CUUSOO project! My hats will soon be gone, but my gravatar could then be yours to keep!
